definitions.definition: A place of safety.
The protection, physical and legal, afforded by such a place.
A place of protection or restraint for one or more classes of the disadvantaged, especially the mentally ill.
To move, pass, or go forward or onward; to advance; to carry on
definitions.example: To proceed on a journey.

definitions.definition: To pass from one point, topic, or stage, to another.
definitions.example: To proceed with a story or argument.

definitions.definition: To come from; to have as its source or origin.
definitions.example: Light proceeds from the sun.

definitions.definition: To go on in an orderly or regulated manner; to begin and carry on a series of acts or measures; to act methodically
To be transacted; to take place; to occur.
(of a rule) To be applicable or effective; to be valid.
To begin and carry on a legal process.
To take an academic degree.
The act of one who proceeds, or who prosecutes a design or transaction
An event or happening; something that happens
(always in plural) A published collection of papers presented at an academic conference, or representing the acts of a learned society.
Progress or movement from one thing to another.
A measure or step taken in a course of business; a transaction
definitions.example: a cautious or a violent proceeding

definitions.definition: Any legal action, especially one that is not a lawsuit.
To throw into confusion or disorder.
definitions.example: Hecklers disrupted the man's speech.

definitions.definition: To interrupt or impede.
definitions.example: Work on the tunnel was disrupted by a strike.

definitions.definition: To improve a product or service in ways that displace an established one and surprise the market.
definitions.example: The internet makes it easier for leaner businesses to disrupt the larger and more unwieldy ones.

definitions.definition: Torn off or torn asunder; severed; disrupted.
To provide someone with an incentive to do something; to encourage.
definitions.example: The weekly staff meeting was meant to motivate employees.

definitions.definition: To animate; to propel; to cause to take action
definitions.example: He was motivated purely by self-interest.

definitions.definition: To cause someone to become annoyed or angry.
definitions.example: Don't provoke the dog; it may try to bite you.

definitions.definition: To bring about a reaction.
To appeal.

A member of the lowly social class that toils on the land, constituted by small farmers and tenants, sharecroppers, farmhands and other laborers on the land where they form the main labor force in agriculture and horticulture.
A country person.
An uncouth, crude or ill-bred person.
(strategy games) A worker unit.
A challenge.
To challenge (someone) or brave (a hazard or opposition).
definitions.example: to defy an enemy;   to defy the power of a magistrate;   to defy the arguments of an opponent;   to defy public opinion

definitions.definition: To refuse to obey.
definitions.example: If you defy your teacher you may end up in detention.

definitions.definition: To not conform to or follow a pattern, set of rules or expectations.
To renounce or dissolve all bonds of affiance, faith, or obligation with; to reject, refuse, or renounce.
A public building or room for entertainment, especially gambling.
A card game for two to four players.
The act of suspending, or the state of being suspended.
definitions.example: suspension from a hook

definitions.definition: A temporary or conditional delay, interruption or discontinuation.
The state of a solid or substance produced when its particles are mixed with, but not dissolved in, a fluid, and are capable of separation by straining.
The act of keeping a person who is listening in doubt and expectation of what is to follow.
The temporary barring of a person from a workplace, society, etc. pending investigation into alleged misconduct.
The process of barring a student from school grounds as a form of punishment (particularly out-of-school suspension).
definitions.example: suspension from school as a disciplinary measure

definitions.definition: The act of or discord produced by prolonging one or more tones of a chord into the chord which follows, thus producing a momentary discord, suspending the concord which the ear expects.
A stay or postponement of the execution of a sentence, usually by letters of suspension granted on application to the Lord Ordinary.
A topological space derived from another by taking the product of the original space with an interval and collapsing each end of the product to a point.
A function derived, in a standard way, from another, such that the instant function's domain and codomain are suspensions of the original function's.
The system of springs and shock absorbers connected to the wheels in an automobile, which allows the vehicle to move smoothly with reduced shock to its occupants.
To develop an idea; to form in the mind; to plan; to devise; to originate.
To understand (someone).
To become pregnant (with).
definitions.example: Assisted procreation can help those trying to conceive.

definitions.definition: A claim to commendation or a reward.
A mark or token of approbation or to recognize excellence.
definitions.example: For her good performance in the examination, her teacher gave her ten merits.

definitions.definition: Something deserving or worthy of positive recognition or reward.
definitions.example: His reward for his merit was a check for $50.

definitions.definition: The sum of all the good deeds that a person does which determines the quality of the person's next state of existence and contributes to the person's growth towards enlightenment.
definitions.example: to acquire or make merit

definitions.definition: Usually in the plural form the merits: the substantive rightness or wrongness of a legal argument, a lawsuit, etc., as opposed to technical matters such as the admissibility of evidence or points of legal procedure; (by extension) the overall good or bad quality, or rightness or wrongness, of some other thing.
definitions.example: Even though the plaintiff was ordered by the judge to pay some costs for not having followed the correct procedure, she won the case on the merits.

definitions.definition: The quality or state of deserving retribution, whether reward or punishment.
To deserve, to earn.
definitions.example: Her performance merited wild applause.

definitions.definition: To be deserving or worthy.
definitions.example: They were punished as they merited.

definitions.definition: To reward.
To forbid, disallow, or proscribe officially; to make illegal or illicit.
definitions.example: The restaurant prohibits smoking on the patio.

definitions.definition: The drawing of air into the lungs, accomplished in mammals by elevation of the chest walls and flattening of the diaphragm, as part of the act of respiration.
A breath, a single inhalation.

A supernatural divine influence on the prophets, apostles, or sacred writers, by which they were qualified to communicate moral or religious truth with authority; a supernatural influence which qualifies people to receive and communicate divine truth; also, the truth communicated.
The act of an elevating or stimulating influence upon the intellect, emotions or creativity.
definitions.example: She was waiting for inspiration to write a book.

definitions.definition: A person, object, or situation which quickens or stimulates an influence upon the intellect, emotions or creativity.
definitions.example: The trip was an inspiration to her for writing a book.

definitions.definition: A new idea, especially one which arises suddenly and is clever or creative.
The property of being fair or equitable.
definitions.example: Some questioned the fairness of the new laws.

definitions.definition: The property of being fair or beautiful.
A hard growth of keratin that protrudes from the top of the head of certain animals, usually paired.

Any similar real or imaginary growth or projection such as the elongated tusk of a narwhal, the eyestalk of a snail, the pointed growth on the nose of a rhinoceros, or the hornlike projection on the head of a demon or similar.
An antler.
The hard substance from which animals' horns are made, sometimes used by man as a material for making various objects.
definitions.example: an umbrella with a handle made of horn

definitions.definition: An object whose shape resembles a horn, such as cornucopia, the point of an anvil, or a vessel for gunpowder or liquid.
Any of several musical wind instruments.
An instrument resembling a musical horn and used to signal others.
definitions.example: hunting horn

definitions.definition: A loud alarm, especially one on a motor vehicle.
A sound signaling the expiration of time.
definitions.example: The shot was after the horn and therefore did not count.

definitions.definition: A conical device used to direct waves.
definitions.example: antenna horn

definitions.definition: Generally, any brass wind instrument.
(from the horn-shaped earpieces of old communication systems that used air tubes) A telephone.
definitions.example: Get him on the horn so that we can have a discussion about this.

definitions.definition: (definite article) An erection of the penis.
A peninsula or crescent-shaped tract of land.
definitions.example: to navigate around the horn

definitions.definition: A diacritical mark that may be attached to the top right corner of the letters o and u when writing in Vietnamese, thus forming ơ and ư.
An incurved, tapering and pointed appendage found in the flowers of the milkweed (Asclepias).
(of an animal) To assault with the horns.
To furnish with horns.
To cuckold.
The state of being isolated, detached, or separated.
The state of being away from other people.
The act of isolating.
definitions.example: Social distancing is social isolation, which is a human rights violation on par with torture and other war crimes.

definitions.definition: (of a country) The state of not having diplomatic relations with other countries (either with most or all other countries, or with specified other countries).
The obtaining of an element from one of its compounds, or of a compound from a mixture
The separation of a patient, suffering from a contagious disease, from contact with others (compare: quarantine)
A database property that determines when and how changes made in one transaction are visible to other concurrent transactions.
The third season of the year; autumn; fall.
definitions.example: Harvest is usually very damp and rainy.

definitions.definition: The season of gathering ripened crops; specifically, the time of reaping and gathering grain.
The process of gathering the ripened crop; harvesting.
The yield of harvesting, i.e., the gathered crops or fruits.
definitions.example: This year's cotton harvest was great but the corn harvest was disastrous.

definitions.definition: (by extension) The product or result of any exertion or course of action; reward or consequences.
A modern pagan ceremony held on or around the autumn equinox, which is in the harvesting season.
To bring in a harvest; reap; glean.
To be occupied bringing in a harvest
definitions.example: Harvesting is a stressing, thirsty occupation

definitions.definition: To win, achieve a gain.
definitions.example: The rising star harvested well-deserved acclaim, even an Oscar under 21

definitions.definition: The act of placing or putting in place; the act of locating or positioning; the state of being placed.
A location or position.
definitions.example: It seems to me that the placement of that poster could be better.

definitions.definition: The act of matching a person with a job
definitions.example: The agency does not guarantee placement, but they work on commission.

definitions.definition: Desire to eat food or consume drink.
Any strong desire; an eagerness or longing.
The desire for some personal gratification, either of the body or of the mind.
definitions.example: appetite for reading

definitions.definition: Something which is not genuine, or is presented fraudulently.
A trick; a swindle.
A move meant to deceive an opposing player, used for gaining advantage for example when dribbling an opponent.
To cheat; to swindle; to steal; to rob.
To modify fraudulently, so as to make an object appear better or other than it really is
To make a counterfeit, to counterfeit, to forge, to falsify.
To make a false display of, to affect, to feign, to simulate.
definitions.example: to fake a marriage

definitions.definition: Not real; false, fraudulent.
definitions.example: Which fur coat looks fake?

definitions.definition: (of people) Insincere.
One of the circles or windings of a cable or hawser, as it lies in a coil; a single turn or coil.
To coil (a rope, line, or hawser), by winding alternately in opposite directions, in layers usually of zigzag or figure of eight form, to prevent twisting when running out.
To frighten greatly; to fill with terror.
To menace or intimidate.
To make terrible.
An adverse judgment or opinion formed beforehand or without knowledge of the facts.
Any preconceived opinion or feeling, whether positive or negative.
An irrational hostile attitude, fear or hatred towards a particular group, race or religion.
definitions.example: I am free of all prejudices. I hate everyone equally.

definitions.definition: Knowledge formed in advance; foresight, presaging.
Mischief; hurt; damage; injury; detriment.
To have a negative impact on (someone's position, chances etc.).
To cause prejudice in; to bias the mind of.
A structure built by a bird as a place to incubate eggs and rear young.
A place used by another mammal, fish, amphibian or insect, for depositing eggs and hatching young.
A snug, comfortable, or cosy residence or job situation.
A retreat, or place of habitual resort.
A hideout for bad people to frequent or haunt; a den.
definitions.example: That nightclub is a nest of strange people!

definitions.definition: A home that a child or young adult shares with a parent or guardian.
definitions.example: I am aspiring to leave the nest.

definitions.definition: A fixed number of cards in some bidding games awarded to the highest bidder allowing him to exchange any or all with cards in his hand.
definitions.example: I was forced to change trumps when I found the ace, jack, and nine of diamonds in the nest.

definitions.definition: A fortified position for a weapon.
A structure consisting of nested structures, such as nested loops or nested subroutine calls.
A circular bed of pasta, rice, etc. to be topped or filled with other foods.
An aggregated mass of any ore or mineral, in an isolated state, within a rock.
A collection of boxes, cases, or the like, of graduated size, each put within the one next larger.
A compact group of pulleys, gears, springs, etc., working together or collectively.
(of animals) To build or settle into a nest.
To settle into a home.
definitions.example: We loved the new house and were nesting there in two days!

definitions.definition: To successively neatly fit inside another.
definitions.example: I bought a set of nesting mixing bowls for my mother.

definitions.definition: To place in, or as if in, a nest.
To place one thing neatly inside another, and both inside yet another (and so on).
definitions.example: There would be much more room in the attic if you had nested all the empty boxes.

definitions.definition: To hunt for birds' nests or their contents (usually "go nesting").
To paint or draw the likeness of.
definitions.example: I will portray a king on horseback.

definitions.definition: To describe in words; to convey.
To play a role; to depict a character, person, situation, or event.
definitions.example: For my next movie, I will be portraying Shakespeare.

definitions.definition: To adorn.
An excessively violent or vicious attack; an atrocity.
An offensive, immoral or indecent act.
The resentful anger aroused by such acts.
A destructive rampage.
To cause or commit an outrage upon; to treat with violence or abuse.
To violate; to rape (a female).
To rage in excess of.
A going; journey; travel; voyage; course; passage.
Money paid for a transport ticket.
A paying passenger, especially in a taxi.
Food and drink.
Supplies for consumption or pleasure.
A prostitute's client.
To go, travel.
definitions.example: Behold! A knight fares forth.

definitions.definition: To get along, succeed (well or badly); to be in any state, or pass through any experience, good or bad; to be attended with any circumstances or train of events.
To eat, dine.
To happen well, or ill.
definitions.example: We shall see how it will fare with him.

definitions.definition: To move along; proceed; progress; advance
definitions.example: We will continue to monitor how the hurricane fares against projected models.

definitions.definition: An unrealistic story depicting past events.
A person related to a legend or legends.
A key to the symbols and color codes on a map, chart, etc.
definitions.example: According to the legend on the map, that building is a school.

definitions.definition: An inscription, motto, or title, especially one surrounding the field in a medal or coin, or placed upon a heraldic shield or beneath an engraving or illustration.
A musical composition set to a poetical story.
To tell or narrate; to recount.
A violent onset or attack with physical means, for example blows, weapons, etc.
definitions.example: to make assault upon a man, a house, or a town

definitions.definition: A violent onset or attack with moral weapons, for example words, arguments, appeals, and the like
definitions.example: to make an assault on the prerogatives of a prince, or on the constitution of a government

definitions.definition: An attempt to commit battery: a violent attempt, or willful effort with force or violence, to do hurt to another, but without necessarily touching his person, as by lifting a fist in a threatening manner, or by striking at him and missing him.
The crime whose action is such an attempt.
An act that causes someone to apprehend imminent bodily harm.
The tort whose action is such an act.
A non-competitive combat between two fencers.
To attack, physically or figuratively.
definitions.example: Loud music assaulted our ears as we entered the building.

definitions.definition: To threaten or harass.
A quick, brilliant, and highly successful act.
(of Native Americans) A blow against an enemy delivered in a way that shows bravery.
A coup d'état.
(by extension) A takeover of one group by another.
A single roll of the wheel at roulette, or a deal in rouge et noir.
One of various named strategies employed by the declarer to win more tricks, such as the Bath coup.
To make a coup.
(furniture) Following or imitating a style popular during the First French Empire (1804–1814).
(of wine) Produced in a dependency of the British Empire or Commonwealth of Nations.
A political unit, typically having an extensive territory or comprising a number of territories or nations (especially one comprising one or more kingdoms) and ruled by a single supreme authority.
definitions.example: the Russian empire

definitions.definition: A political unit ruled by an emperor or empress.
definitions.example: The Empire of Vietnam was a short-lived client state of Japan governing Vietnam between March 11 and August 23, 1945.

definitions.definition: A group of states or other territories that owe allegiance to a foreign power.
An expansive and powerful enterprise under the control of one person or group.
definitions.example: the McDonald's fast food empire

definitions.definition: (Absolute) control, dominion, sway.
To make something by merging parts.
definitions.example: The editor composed a historical journal from many individual letters.

definitions.definition: To make up the whole; to constitute.
definitions.example: A church is composed of its members.

definitions.definition: To comprise.
To construct by mental labor; to think up; particularly, to produce or create a literary or musical work.
definitions.example: It's difficult to compose without absolute silence.

definitions.definition: (sometimes reflexive) To calm; to free from agitation.
definitions.example: The defendant couldn't compose herself and was found in contempt.

definitions.definition: To arrange the elements of a photograph or other picture.
To settle (an argument, dispute etc.); to come to a settlement.
To arrange in proper form; to reduce to order; to put in proper state or condition.
To arrange (types) in a composing stick for printing; to typeset.
A rational number: a number that can be expressed as the quotient of two integers.
definitions.example: The quotient of two rationals is again a rational.

definitions.definition: Capable of reasoning.
definitions.example: Man is a rational creature.

definitions.definition: Logically sound; not contradictory or otherwise absurd.
definitions.example: His statements were quite rational.

definitions.definition: (of a person or personal characteristics) Healthy or balanced intellectually; exhibiting reasonableness.
definitions.example: rational conduct

definitions.definition: Of a number, capable of being expressed as the ratio of two integers.
definitions.example: ¾ is a rational number, but √2 is an irrational number.

definitions.definition: Of an algebraic expression, capable of being expressed as the ratio of two polynomials.
Expressing the type, structure, relations, and reactions of a compound; graphic; said of formulae.
Expressing a physical object.
definitions.example: A rational table is physical, a written table is neither.

definitions.definition: The breastplate worn by Israelite high priests.
The state or act of contemning; the feeling or attitude of regarding someone or something as inferior, base, or worthless; scorn, disdain.
The state of being despised or dishonored; disgrace.
Open disrespect or willful disobedience of the authority of a court of law or legislative body.
A professional who counsels people, especially on personal problems.
A school counselor, often in a specialty such as careers, education, or health.
An attorney.
A high ranking diplomat, usually just below an ambassador or minister.
A children’s supervisor, usually at camp.
An official formal accusation for a criminal offence, or the process by which it is brought to a jury.
The official legal document outlining the charges concerned; bill of indictment.
An accusation of wrongdoing; a criticism or condemnation.
To go in the reverse direction.
definitions.example: the train backed into the station;  the horse refuses to back

definitions.definition: To support.
definitions.example: I back you all the way;  which horse are you backing in this race?

definitions.definition: (of the wind) To change direction contrary to the normal pattern; that is, to shift anticlockwise in the northern hemisphere, or clockwise in the southern hemisphere.
(of a square sail) To brace the yards so that the wind presses on the front of the sail, to slow the ship.
(of an anchor) To lay out a second, smaller anchor to provide additional holding power.
(of a hunting dog) To stand still behind another dog which has pointed.
To push or force backwards.
definitions.example: The mugger backed her into a corner and demanded her wallet.

definitions.definition: To get upon the back of; to mount.
To place or seat upon the back.
To make a back for; to furnish with a back.
definitions.example: to back books

definitions.definition: To adjoin behind; to be at the back of.
To write upon the back of, possibly as an endorsement.
definitions.example: to back a letter;  to back a note or legal document

definitions.definition: (of a justice of the peace) To sign or endorse (a warrant, issued in another county, to apprehend an offender).
To row backward with (oars).
definitions.example: to back the oars

definitions.definition: Support, especially financial.
definitions.example: It's a volunteer organization that works with backing from the city and a few grants.

definitions.definition: A liner or other material added behind or underneath.
definitions.example: The cardboard backing gives the notebook a little extra stiffness.

definitions.definition: A backdrop.
Musicians and vocalists who support the main performer.
The mounting of a horse or other animal.
The action of putting something back; a switching into reverse.
Providing support for the main performer.
The right by law to be the entity which determines who may publish, copy and distribute a piece of writing, music, picture or other work of authorship.
definitions.example: Copyright is a separate legal area from trademarks.

definitions.definition: Such an exclusive right as it pertains to one or more specific works.
definitions.example: The artist lost the copyrights to her songs when she signed the contract.

definitions.definition: To obtain or secure a copyright for some literary or other artistic work.
A confinement in a place, especially a prison or a jail, as punishment for a crime.
Two people who work or collaborate together as partners; especially, those who perform music together.
Any pair of two people.
Any cocktail consisting of a spirit and a liqueur.
A song in two parts; a duet.
Relating to or being the second of two items.
Near (or nearer) to the end.
In the past, but close (or closer) to the present time.
To name someone as a candidate for a particular role or position, including that of an office.
To entitle, confer a name upon.
definitions.example: 1658: the City of Norwich [...] was enlarged, builded and nominated by the Saxons. — Sir Thomas Browne, Urne-Burial (Penguin 2005, p. 12)

definitions.definition: Nominotypical
definitions.example: the nominate subspecies

definitions.definition: To move into.
definitions.example: Under some circumstances police are allowed to invade a person's privacy.

definitions.definition: To enter by force in order to conquer.
definitions.example: Argentinian troops invaded the Falkland Islands in 1982.

definitions.definition: To infest or overrun.
definitions.example: The picnic was invaded by ants.

definitions.definition: To attack; to infringe; to encroach on; to violate.
definitions.example: The king invaded the rights of the people.

definitions.definition: To make an unwelcome or uninvited visit or appearance, usually with an intent to cause trouble or some other unpleasant situation.
One who composes; an author.
One who, or that which, quiets or calms.
A medical facility, such as a hospital, especially one for the treatment and diagnosis of outpatients.
(by extension) A hospital session to diagnose or treat patients.
A school, or a session of a school or class, in which medicine or surgery is taught by the examination and treatment of patients in the presence of the pupils.
A group practice of several physicians.
A meeting for the diagnosis of problems, or training, on a particular subject.
A temporary office arranged on a regular basis to allow politicians to meet their constituents.
A series of workouts used to build skills of practitioners regardless of team affiliation.
One confined to bed by sickness.
One who receives baptism on a sickbed.
A normally regular beat felt when arteries are depressed, caused by the pumping action of the heart.
A beat or throb.
The beat or tactus of a piece of music.
An autosoliton
To beat, to throb, to flash.
definitions.example: In the dead of night, all was still but the pulsing light.

definitions.definition: To flow, particularly of blood.
definitions.example: Hot blood pulses through my veins.

definitions.definition: To emit in discrete quantities.
To operate a blender in short bursts, to break down ingredients without liquidizing them.
Any annual legume yielding from 1 to 12 grains or seeds within a pod, and used as food for humans or animals, especially in the mature, dry condition.
To cause to move faster; to quicken the motion of; to add to the speed of.
To quicken the natural or ordinary progression or process of.
definitions.example: to accelerate the growth of a plant, the increase of wealth, etc.

definitions.definition: To cause a change of velocity.
To hasten, as the occurrence of an event.
definitions.example: to accelerate our departure

definitions.definition: To enable a student to finish a course of study in less than normal time.
To become faster; to begin to move more quickly.
Grow; increase.
Accelerated; quickened; hastened; hurried.
A length of some object.
definitions.example: a segment of rope

definitions.definition: One of the parts into which any body naturally separates or is divided; a part divided or cut off; a section; a portion.
definitions.example: a segment of an orange;   a segment of a compound or divided leaf

definitions.definition: A portion.
A portion.
A part of a broadcast program, devoted to a topic.
definitions.example: The news showed a segment on global warming.

definitions.definition: An Ethernet bus.
A region of memory or a fragment of an executable file designated to contain a particular part of a program.
(travel) A portion of an itinerary: it may be a flight or train between two cities, or a car or hotel booked in a particular city.
A bearing representing only one part of a rounded object.
To divide into segments or sections.
definitions.example: Segment the essay by topic.

definitions.definition: A hole in the ground.
definitions.example: The meadow around the town is full of old pits.

definitions.definition: An area at a racetrack used for refueling and repairing the vehicles during a race.
definitions.example: Two drivers have already gone into the pit this early in the race.

definitions.definition: A section of the marching band containing mallet percussion instruments and other large percussion instruments too large to march, such as the tam tam. Also, the area on the sidelines where these instruments are placed.
A mine.

A hole or trench in the ground, excavated according to grid coordinates, so that the provenance of any feature observed and any specimen or artifact revealed may be established by precise measurement.
A trading pit.
The bottom part of something.
definitions.example: I felt pain in the pit of my stomach.

definitions.definition: Armpit.
A luggage hold.
A small surface hole or depression, a fossa.
The indented mark left by a pustule, as in smallpox.
The grave, or underworld.
An enclosed area into which gamecocks, dogs, and other animals are brought to fight, or where dogs are trained to kill rats.

Formerly, that part of a theatre, on the floor of the house, below the level of the stage and behind the orchestra; now, in England, commonly the part behind the stalls; in the United States, the parquet; also, the occupants of such a part of a theatre.
Part of a casino which typically holds tables for blackjack, craps, roulette, and other games.
A pit bull terrier.
definitions.example: I'm taking one of my pits to the vet on Thursday.

definitions.definition: A mosh pit.
definitions.example: Because the museum was closed for renovation, the school decided to bring its fourth-graders to the pit at a Cannibal Corpse gig instead.

definitions.definition: (law enforcement, usually used with "maneuver") A maneuver by which a police officer, by use of a police car, nudges the vehicle of a fleeing suspect enough for the suspect's vehicle to lose control and become disabled so the police officer can catch and apprehend the suspect.
The fissile core of a nuclear weapon, commonly made of plutonium surrounded by high-explosive lenses.
(hospital slang) The emergency department.
To make pits in; to mark with little hollows.
definitions.example: Exposure to acid rain pitted the metal.

definitions.definition: To put (an animal) into a pit for fighting.
To bring (something) into opposition with something else.
definitions.example: Are you ready to pit your wits against one of the world's greatest puzzles?

definitions.definition: To return to the pits during a race for refuelling, tyre changes, repairs etc.
A seed inside a fruit; a stone or pip inside a fruit.
A shell in a drupe containing a seed.
The core of an implosion weapon, consisting of the fissile material and any neutron reflector or tamper bonded to it.
To remove the stone from a stone fruit or the shell from a drupe.
definitions.example: One must pit a peach to make it ready for a pie.

definitions.definition: A pit bull terrier.
A cover, or partial cover, for the face, used for disguise or protection.
definitions.example: a dancer's mask; a fencer's mask; a ball player's mask

definitions.definition: That which disguises; a pretext or subterfuge.
A festive entertainment of dancing or other diversions, where all wear masks; a masquerade
A person wearing a mask.
A dramatic performance, formerly in vogue, in which the actors wore masks and represented mythical or allegorical characters.
A grotesque head or face, used to adorn keystones and other prominent parts, to spout water in fountains, and the like
(fortification) In a permanent fortification, a redoubt which protects the caponiere.
(fortification) A screen for a battery
The lower lip of the larva of a dragonfly, modified so as to form a prehensile organ.

A pattern of bits used in bitwise operations; bitmask.
A two-color (black and white) bitmap generated from an image, used to create transparency in the image.
The head of a fox, shown face-on and cut off immediately behind the ears.
To cover (the face or something else), in order to conceal the identity or protect against injury; to cover with a mask or visor.
To disguise; to cover; to hide.
To conceal; also, to intervene in the line of.
To cover or keep in check.

To wear a mask; to be disguised in any way

To disable (an interrupt, etc.) by setting or unsetting the associated bit.

An instance of moving to live in another place for a while.
Seasonal moving of animals, as mammals, birds or fish, especially between breeding and non-breeding areas.
Movement in general.

The movement of cells in particular directions to specific locations.
The fact of being equal.
The fact of being equal, of having the same value.
The equal treatment of people irrespective of social or cultural differences.
A need or compelling desire for food.

Relating to literature.

Appropriate to literature rather than everyday writing.
Bookish.
The study of God, a god, or gods; and of the truthfulness of religion in general.

Subjective marginal details.
An instance of colliding.

The combined anchoring gear (anchor, rode, bill/peak and fittings such as bitts, cat, and windlass.)
Representation of the nautical tool, used as a heraldic charge.

Any instrument serving a purpose like that of a ship's anchor, such as an arrangement of timber to hold a dam fast; a device to hold the end of a bridge cable etc.; or a device used in metalworking to hold the core of a mould in place.
A marked point in a document that can be the target of a hyperlink.
An anchorman or anchorwoman.
The final runner in a relay race.
A point that is touched by the draw hand or string when the bow is fully drawn and ready to shoot.
A superstore or other facility that serves as a focus to bring customers into an area.
That which gives stability or security.
A metal tie holding adjoining parts of a building together.
Carved work, somewhat resembling an anchor or arrowhead; part of the ornaments of certain mouldings. It is seen in the echinus, or egg-and-anchor (called also egg-and-dart, egg-and-tongue) ornament.

One of the calcareous spinules of certain holothurians, as in species of Synapta.
The thirty-fifth Lenormand card.
An anchorite or anchoress.
To connect an object, especially a ship or a boat, to a fixed point.
To cast anchor; to come to anchor.

To perform as an anchorman or anchorwoman.
To be stuck; to be unable to move away from a position.

definitions.definition: Listing, division or categorization in great detail

definitions.definition: A detailed description of a forthcoming project, including the characters and roles required.
Breaking of chemical bonds within a compound to produce simpler compounds or elements.
A musical technique by which the music is stripped down, becoming simpler, varying in heaviness depending on the genre.
A loss of organization (of the parts of a system).

Any crude, noisy dance performed by shuffling the feet, usually by one person at a time.
Any rapid bluegrass dance tune, especially featuring a five-string banjo.

definitions.definition: The percussion break of songs chosen by a DJ for use in hip-hop music.
The main business part of a city or town, usually located at or near its center.
Of, relating to, or situated in the central business district

definitions.definition: Outside the three-point line, or generally far from the basket.

definitions.definition: A series of comments or annotations; especially, a book of explanations or expositions on the whole or a part of some other work
(usually in the plural) a brief account of transactions or events written hastily, as if for a memorandum

definitions.definition: An oral relation of an event, especially broadcast by television or radio, as it occurs

definitions.definition: Deployment
To prepare and arrange (usually military unit or units) for use.

definitions.definition: To unfold, open, or otherwise become ready for use.

definitions.definition: To install, test and implement a computer system or application.

definitions.definition: Arousing controversy—a debate or discussion of opposing opinions.
One of a set of parallel lines.
Direction conformable to that of another line.
A line of latitude.

definitions.definition: An arrangement of electrical components such that a current flows along two or more paths; see in parallel.
Something identical or similar in essential respects.
A comparison made; elaborate tracing of similarity.

definitions.definition: One of a series of long trenches constructed before a besieged fortress, by the besieging force, as a cover for troops supporting the attacking batteries. They are roughly parallel to the line of outer defenses of the fortress.
A character consisting of two parallel vertical lines, used in the text to direct attention to a similarly marked note in the margin or at the foot of a page.
To construct or place something parallel to something else.
Of a path etc: To be parallel to something else.
Of a process etc: To be analogous to something else.
To compare or liken something to something else.
To make to conform to something else in character, motive, aim, etc.
To equal; to match; to correspond to.
To produce or adduce as a parallel.
Equally distant from one another at all points.

definitions.definition: Having the same overall direction; the comparison is indicated with "to".
definitions.example: The two railway lines are parallel.

definitions.definition: (hyperbolic geometry, said of a pair of lines) Either not intersecting, or coinciding.
Involving the processing of multiple tasks at the same time.

definitions.definition: With a parallel relationship.

definitions.definition: Freight carried by a ship, aircraft, or motor vehicle.
(Papua New Guinea) Western material goods.
An exercise session; a period of physical exercise.
A schedule or program of specific exercises, especially one intended to achieve a particular goal.
(by extension) Any activity that requires much physical or mental effort, or produces strain.
The process of becoming a more interconnected world.
The process of the world economy becoming dominated by capitalist models, according to the World System Theory.
Balls or pieces of ice falling as precipitation, often in connection with a thunderstorm.
Of hail, to fall from the sky.

definitions.definition: To pour down in rapid succession.
To greet; give salutation to; salute.
To name; to designate; to call.

definitions.definition: To call out loudly in order to gain the attention of
definitions.example: Hail a taxi.

definitions.definition: To signal in order to initiate communication with.
Healthy, whole, safe.
Doctrine, philosophy, body of beliefs or principles belonging to an individual or group.

definitions.definition: The study of the origin and nature of ideas.
A low-pitched, resonant sound, such as of an explosion.

definitions.definition: A rapid expansion or increase.

definitions.definition: One of the calls of certain monkeys or birds.
To make a loud, hollow, resonant sound.

definitions.definition: (of speech) To exclaim with force, to shout, to thunder.
To make something boom.

definitions.definition: To publicly praise.
To rush with violence and noise, as a ship under a press of sail, before a free wind.
Used to suggest the sound of an explosion.
Used to suggest something happening suddenly and unexpectedly.
A spar extending the foot of a sail; a spar rigged outboard from a ship's side to which boats are secured in harbour.
A movable pole used to support a microphone or camera.
A horizontal member of a crane or derrick, used for lifting.
The longest element of a Yagi antenna, on which the other, smaller ones are transversally mounted.
A floating barrier used to obstruct navigation, for military or other purposes; or used for the containment of an oil spill or to control the flow of logs from logging operations.
A wishbone-shaped piece of windsurfing equipment.
The section of the arm on a backhoe closest to the tractor.
A gymnastics apparatus similar to a balance beam.
To extend, or push, with a boom or pole.

A period of prosperity, growth, progress, or high market activity.
To flourish, grow, or progress.

definitions.definition: To cause to advance rapidly in price.

To believe (something is reasonable) and argue (for it); to advocate.

Sails in general.
A tent.

definitions.definition: A painting, or a picture on canvas.

Alternative spelling of canvass.
To cover an area or object with canvas.
Alternative spelling of canvass.
A case for carrying papers, drawings, photographs, maps and other flat documents.

The post and the responsibilities of a cabinet minister or other head of a government department.

definitions.definition: An official indicator that things will happen as planned.

A fair valuation or estimate of merit, worth, weight, etc.; recognition of excellence.

definitions.definition: Accurate perception; true estimation.

definitions.definition: A rise in value.
Great or overwhelming beauty or splendour.
Honour, admiration, or distinction, accorded by common consent to a person or thing; high reputation; renown.
That quality in a person or thing which secures general praise or honour.
Worship or praise.

An optical phenomenon, consisting of concentric rings and somewhat similar to a rainbow, caused by sunlight or moonlight interacting with the water droplets that compose mist or clouds, centered on the antisolar or antilunar point.
Victory; success.
An emanation of light supposed to shine from beings that are specially holy. It is represented in art by rays of gold, or the like, proceeding from the head or body, or by a disk, or a mere line.
The manifestation of the presence of God as perceived by humans in Abrahamic religions.
Pride; boastfulness; arrogance.
To exult with joy; to rejoice.
To boast; to be proud.
To shine radiantly.
The act of pulling back or withdrawing, as from something dangerous, or unpleasant.
The act of reversing direction and receding from a forward position.
A peaceful, quiet place affording privacy or security.
A peaceful, quiet place in which to urinate and defecate: an outhouse; a lavatory.
A period of retirement, seclusion, or solitude.
A period of meditation, prayer or study.
Withdrawal by military force from a dangerous position or from enemy attack.
A signal for a military withdrawal.
A bugle call or drumbeat signaling the lowering of the flag at sunset, as on a military base.
A military ceremony to lower the flag.
The move of a piece from a threatened position.
To withdraw from a position, go back.
(of a glacier) To shrink back due to generally warmer temperatures.
To slope back.

Any of several birds in the family Rallidae.

Specifically, a woman's headscarf or neckerchief.
(of a liquid) To gush, flow.
A small, round spot.

A point used as a diacritical mark above or below various letters of the Latin script, as in Ȧ, Ạ, Ḅ, Ḃ, Ċ.
A symbol used for separating the fractional part of a decimal number from the whole part, for indicating multiplication or a scalar product, or for various other purposes.

Anything small and like a speck comparatively; a small portion or specimen.

Buckshot, projectile from a "dotty" or shotgun
To cover with small spots (of some liquid).

Dot product of the previous vector and the following vector.
A dowry.
The ninth hour of the day counted from sunrise; around three o'clock in the afternoon.
Time of day when the sun is in its zenith; twelve o'clock in the day, midday.
The corresponding time in the middle of the night; midnight.

definitions.definition: The highest point; culmination.
To relax or sleep around midday
The letter ن in the Arabic script.
The act or process of expanding.

definitions.definition: The fractional change in unit length per unit length per unit temperature change.
A new addition.

definitions.definition: A product to be used with a previous product.

definitions.definition: That which is expanded; expanse; extended surface.
(steam engines) The operation of steam in a cylinder after its communication with the boiler has been cut off, by which it continues to exert pressure upon the moving piston.
An argument or debate.
definitions.example: They had a bit of a disagreement about what color to paint the bedroom, but they have reached a compromise.

definitions.definition: A condition of not agreeing or concurring.
definitions.example: The theory shows considerable disagreement with the data.

definitions.definition: The act of preserving, guarding, or protecting; the keeping (of a thing) in a safe or entire state; preservation.
Wise use of natural resources.
The discipline concerned with protection of biodiversity, the environment, and natural resources

Genes and associated characteristics of biological organisms that are unchanged by evolution, for example similar or identical nucleic acid sequences or proteins in different species descended from a common ancestor
(culture) The protection and care of cultural heritage, including artwork and architecture, as well as historical and archaeological artifacts
Lack of change in a measurable property of an isolated physical system (conservation of energy, mass, momentum, electric charge, subatomic particles, and fundamental symmetries)
Accordance with moral principles; conformity of behaviour or thought with the strictures of morality; good moral conduct.
definitions.example: Without virtue, there is no freedom.

definitions.definition: A particular manifestation of moral excellence in a person; an admirable quality.
Specifically, each of several qualities held to be particularly important, including the four cardinal virtues, the three theological virtues, or the seven virtues opposed to the seven deadly sins.
An inherently advantageous or excellent quality of something or someone; a favourable point, an advantage.
A creature embodying divine power, specifically one of the orders of heavenly beings, traditionally ranked above angels and below archangels.
Specifically, moral conduct in sexual behaviour, especially of women; chastity.
The inherent power of a god, or other supernatural being.
The inherent power or efficacy of something (now only in phrases).
A quick breaking or cracking sound or the action of producing such a sound.
A sudden break.
An attempt to seize, bite, attack, or grab.
The act of making a snapping sound by pressing the thumb and an opposing finger of the same hand together and suddenly releasing the grip so that the finger hits against the palm.
A fastening device that makes a snapping sound when used.
A photograph; a snapshot.
definitions.example: We took a few snaps of the old church before moving on.

definitions.definition: The sudden release of something held under pressure or tension.
A thin circular cookie or similar baked good.
definitions.example: a ginger snap

definitions.definition: A brief, sudden period of a certain weather; used primarily in the phrase cold snap.
A very short period of time (figuratively, the time taken to snap one's fingers), or a task that can be accomplished in such a period.
definitions.example: I can fix most vacuum cleaners in a snap.

definitions.definition: A snap bean such as Phaseolus vulgaris.
A backward pass or handoff of a football from its position on the ground that puts the ball in play; a hike.
(somewhat colloquial) A rivet: a scrapbooking embellishment.
A small meal, a snack; lunch.
A card game, primarily for children, in which players cry "snap" to claim pairs of matching cards as they are turned up.
A greedy fellow.
That which is, or may be, snapped up; something bitten off, seized, or obtained by a single quick movement; hence, a bite, morsel, or fragment; a scrap.
Briskness; vigour; energy; decision
Any circumstance out of which money may be made or an advantage gained. used primarily in the phrase soft snap.
Something that is easy or effortless.
A snapper, or snap beetle.
Jounce (the fourth derivative of the position vector with respect to time), followed by crackle and pop
A quick offhand shot with a firearm; a snap shot.
Something of no value.
definitions.example: not worth a snap

definitions.definition: A visual message sent through the Snapchat application.
A crisp or pithy quality; epigrammatic point or force.
A tool used by riveters.
A tool used by glass-moulders.
A brief theatrical engagement.
An easy and profitable place or task; a sinecure.
A cheat or sharper.
To fracture or break apart suddenly.
definitions.example: He snapped his stick in anger.

definitions.definition: To give forth or produce a sharp cracking noise; to crack.
definitions.example: Blazing firewood snaps.

definitions.definition: To attempt to seize with the teeth or bite.
definitions.example: A dog snaps at a passenger. A fish snaps at the bait.

definitions.definition: To attempt to seize with eagerness.
definitions.example: She snapped at the chance to appear on television.

definitions.definition: To speak abruptly or sharply.
definitions.example: He snapped at me for the slightest mistake.

definitions.definition: To give way abruptly and loudly.
To suffer a mental breakdown, usually while under tension.
definitions.example: She should take a break before she snaps.

definitions.definition: To flash or appear to flash as with light.
To fit or fasten together with a snapping sound.
To jump to a fixed position relative to another element.
definitions.example: The floating toolbar will snap to the edge of the screen when dragged towards it.

definitions.definition: To snatch with or as if with the teeth.
To pull apart with a snapping sound; to pop loose.
To say abruptly or sharply.
To speak to abruptly or sharply; to treat snappishly; usually with up.
To cause something to emit a snapping sound.
definitions.example: to snap a fastener

definitions.definition: To close something using a snap as a fastener.

To snap one's fingers: to make a snapping sound, often by pressing the thumb and an opposing finger of the same hand together and suddenly releasing the grip so that the finger hits against the palm; alternatively, by bringing the index finger quickly down onto the middle finger and thumb.
To cause to move suddenly and smartly.
To take a photograph; to release a camera's shutter (which may make a snapping sound).
definitions.example: He snapped a picture of me with my mouth open and my eyes closed.

definitions.definition: To put (a football) in play by a backward pass or handoff from its position on the ground; to hike (a football).
definitions.example: He can snap the ball to a back twenty yards behind him.

definitions.definition: To misfire.
definitions.example: The gun snapped.

definitions.definition: To catch out sharply (a batsman who has just snicked a bowled ball).
Done, made, performed, etc., quickly and unexpectedly, or without deliberation.
definitions.example: a snap judgment or decision    a snap political convention

definitions.definition: The cry used in a game of snap when winning a hand.
By extension from the card game, "I've got one the same!", "Me too!"
definitions.example: Snap! We've both got pink buckets and spades.

definitions.definition: Ritual utterance of agreement (after the cry in the card game snap).
Used in place of expletive to express surprise, usually in response to a negative statement or news; often used facetiously.
definitions.example: "I just ran over your phone with my car." "Oh, snap!"

definitions.definition: Ritual utterance used after something is said by two people at exactly the same time.
definitions.example: "Wasn't that John?" "Wasn't that John?" "Snap!"

definitions.definition: The manner in which something is swung.
definitions.example: Door swing indicates direction the door opens.

definitions.definition: The sweep or compass of a swinging body.
A line, cord, or other thing suspended and hanging loose, upon which anything may swing.
A hanging seat in a children's playground, for acrobats in a circus, or on a porch for relaxing.
A dance style.
The genre of music associated with this dance style.
The amount of change towards or away from something.
Sideways movement of the ball as it flies through the air.
Capacity of a turning lathe, as determined by the diameter of the largest object that can be turned in it.
In a musical theater production, a performer who understudies several roles.
A basic dance step in which a pair link hands and turn round together in a circle.
Free course; unrestrained liberty.
Influence or power of anything put in motion.
A type of hook with the arm more extended.
To rotate about an off-centre fixed point.
definitions.example: The plant swung in the breeze.

definitions.definition: To dance.
To ride on a swing.
definitions.example: The children laughed as they swung.

definitions.definition: To participate in the swinging lifestyle; to participate in wife-swapping.
To hang from the gallows.
(of a ball) to move sideways in its trajectory.
To fluctuate or change.
definitions.example: It wasn't long before the crowd's mood swung towards restless irritability.

definitions.definition: To move (an object) backward and forward; to wave.
definitions.example: He swung his sword as hard as he could.

definitions.definition: To change (a numerical result); especially to change the outcome of an election.
To make (something) work; especially to afford (something) financially.
definitions.example: If it’s not too expensive, I think we can swing it.

definitions.definition: To play notes that are in pairs by making the first of the pair slightly longer than written (augmentation) and the second shorter, resulting in a bouncy, uneven rhythm.
(of a bowler) to make the ball move sideways in its trajectory.
To move one's arm in a punching motion.
In dancing, to turn around in a small circle with one's partner, holding hands or arms.
definitions.example: "to swing one's partner", or simply "to swing"

definitions.definition: To admit or turn something for the purpose of shaping it; said of a lathe.
definitions.example: The lathe can swing a pulley of 12 inches diameter.

definitions.definition: To put (a door, gate, etc.) on hinges so that it can swing or turn.
To turn round by action of wind or tide when at anchor.
definitions.example: A ship swings with the tide.

definitions.definition: A process or result of rebuilding.
To build again.
Furnace or hearth where metals are heated prior to hammering them into shape.
Workshop in which metals are shaped by heating and hammering them.
The act of beating or working iron or steel.
To shape a metal by heating and hammering.
To form or create with concerted effort.
definitions.example: The politician's recent actions are an effort to forge a relationship with undecided voters.

definitions.definition: To create a forgery of; to make a counterfeit item of; to copy or imitate unlawfully.
definitions.example: He had to forge his ex-wife's signature.  The jury learned the documents had been forged.

definitions.definition: To make falsely; to produce, as that which is untrue or not genuine; to fabricate.
(often as forge ahead) To move forward heavily and slowly (originally as a ship); to advance gradually but steadily; to proceed towards a goal in the face of resistance or difficulty.
definitions.example: The party of explorers forged through the thick underbrush.

definitions.definition: (sometimes as forge ahead) To advance, move or act with an abrupt increase in speed or energy.
definitions.example: With seconds left in the race, the runner forged into first place.

definitions.definition: An author of novels.
An innovator; one who introduces something new; one who favours novelty.
A single, distinctive rock formation; an area having a preponderance of a particular rock or group of rocks.
An area of land or the particular features of it.
definitions.example: The race will be run over a variety of terrain, including grass and sand.

definitions.definition: A solemn promise to perform some act, or behave in a specified manner, especially a promise to live and act in accordance with the rules of a religious order.
definitions.example: The old hermit, up in the mountains, took a vow of silence.

definitions.definition: A declaration or assertion.
A votive offering.
To make a vow; to promise.
To make a vow regarding (something).
definitions.example: The wronged woman vowed revenge.

definitions.definition: To declare publicly that one has made a vow, usually to show one's determination or to announce an act of retaliation.
definitions.example: The rebels vowed to continue their fight.

definitions.definition: To bend or move (something) out of a given plane or direction, often the horizontal or vertical.
definitions.example: He had to incline his body against the gusts to avoid being blown down in the storm.

definitions.definition: To slope.
definitions.example: Over the centuries the wind made the walls of the farmhouse incline.

definitions.definition: (chiefly in the passive) To tend to do or believe something, or move or be moved in a certain direction, away from a point of view, attitude, etc.
definitions.example: He inclines to believe anything he reads in the newspapers.

definitions.definition: At an angle to the horizontal; slanted or sloped.
definitions.example: The take-off ramp was inclined at 20 degrees.

definitions.definition: Having a tendency, preference, likelihood, or disposition.
definitions.example: I am inclined to believe you.

definitions.definition: A cavity, hollow, or recess, generally within the thickness of a wall, for a statue, bust, or other erect ornament. Hence, any similar position, literal or figurative.
A function within an ecological system to which an organism is especially suited.
(by extension) Any position of opportunity for which one is well-suited, such as a particular market in business.
An arrow woven into a prayer rug pointing in the direction of qibla.
To place in a niche.
definitions.example: a niched vase

definitions.definition: To specialize in a niche, or particular narrow section of the market.
Pertaining to or intended for a market niche; having specific appeal.
definitions.example: niche audience

definitions.definition: Of, related to, showing, or characterized by sympathy
definitions.example: John looked very upset. I gave him a sympathetic look.

definitions.definition: Relating to similarity
definitions.example: Sympathetic magic is based on imitation or correspondence.

definitions.definition: Relating to the sympathetic nervous system
definitions.example: Sympathetic innervation involves epinephrine.

definitions.definition: Relating to sounds induced by vibrations conveyed through a fluid or gas from a body already in vibration.
Of magic, a supernatural connection or power resulting from two items having the same form or some other correspondence.
An outline of the plot of a dramatic or literary work.
A screenplay itself, or an outline or a treatment of it.
An outline or model of an expected or supposed sequence of events.
A solid mass formed by the coalescence of separate particles; a compound substance, a concretion.
Specifically, a building material created by mixing cement, water, and aggregate such as gravel and sand.
definitions.example: The road was made of concrete that had been poured in large slabs.

definitions.definition: A term designating both a quality and the subject in which it exists; a concrete term.
Sugar boiled down from cane juice to a solid mass.
A dessert of frozen custard with various toppings.
An extract of herbal materials that has a semi-solid consistency, especially when such materials are partly aromatic.
(usually transitive) To cover with or encase in concrete (building material).
definitions.example: I hate grass, so I concreted over my lawn.

definitions.definition: (usually transitive) To solidify: to change from being abstract to being concrete (actual, real).
To unite or coalesce into a mass or a solid body.
Real, actual, tangible.
definitions.example: Fuzzy videotapes and distorted sound recordings are not concrete evidence that bigfoot exists.

definitions.definition: Being or applying to actual things, not abstract qualities or categories.
Particular, specific, rather than general.
definitions.example: While everyone else offered thoughts and prayers, she made a concrete proposal to help.

definitions.definition: United by coalescence of separate particles, or liquid, into one mass or solid.
(modifying a noun) Made of concrete, a building material.
definitions.example: The office building had concrete flower boxes out front.

definitions.definition: Belonging to, or proceeding from the original stock; native
Not counterfeit, spurious, false, or adulterated
definitions.example: a genuine text;  a genuine production;  genuine materials; genuine friendship

definitions.definition: Making active and effective; bringing into a state of activity.
The process of making a radioisotope by bombarding a stable element with neutrons or protons.
(biochemistry) The process through which molecules are made able to react.
An official or authoritative command; an order or injunction; a commission; a judicial precept.
The authority to do something, as granted to a politician by the electorate.
A papal rescript.
A period during which a government is in power.
To authorize
To make mandatory
A device for grasping an object and an attached means of moving it, as a rope and hook.
A block and tackle.
Equipment (rod, reel, line, lure, etc.) used when angling.
(by extension) equipment, gear, gadgetry.
A play where a player attempts to take control over the ball from an opponent, as in rugby or football.
A play where a defender brings the ball carrier to the ground.
Any instance in which one person intercepts another and forces them to the ground.
An offensive line position between a guard and an end: offensive tackle; a person playing that position.
A defensive position between two defensive ends: defensive tackle; a person playing that position.
A man's genitalia.
To force a person to the ground with the weight of one's own body, usually by jumping on top or slamming one's weight into him or her.
To face or deal with, attempting to overcome or fight down.
definitions.example: The government's measures to tackle crime were insufficient.

definitions.definition: To attempt to take away a ball.
To bring a ball carrier to the ground.
To "hit on" or pursue a person that one is interested in.
The act of one who chases another; a pursuit.
A hunt.
A children's game where one player chases another.
A large country estate where game may be shot or hunted.
Anything being chased, especially a vessel in time of war.
A wild animal that is hunted.
Any of the guns that fire directly ahead or astern; either a bow chase or stern chase.

(real tennis) The occurrence of a second bounce by the ball in certain areas of the court, giving the server the chance, later in the game, to "play off" the chase from the receiving end and possibly win the point.

(real tennis) A division of the floor of a gallery, marked by a figure or otherwise; the spot where a ball falls, and between which and the dedans the adversary must drive the ball in order to gain a point.
One or more riders who are ahead of the peloton and trying to join the race or stage leaders.
To pursue.
To consume another beverage immediately after drinking hard liquor, typically something better tasting or less harsh such as soda or beer; to use a drink as a chaser
definitions.example: I need something to chase this shot with.

definitions.definition: To attempt to win by scoring the required number of runs in the final innings.
definitions.example: Australia will be chasing 217 for victory on the final day.

definitions.definition: To swing at a pitch outside of the strike zone, typically an outside pitch
To produce enough offense to cause the pitcher to be removed
definitions.example: The rally chased the starter.

definitions.definition: A rectangular steel or iron frame into which pages or columns of type are locked for printing or plate-making.
A groove cut in an object; a slot: the chase for the quarrel on a crossbow.

A trench or channel or other encasement structure for encasing (archaically spelled enchasing) drainpipes or wiring; a hollow space in the wall of a building encasing ventilation ducts, chimney flues, wires, cables or plumbing.
The part of a gun in front of the trunnions.
The cavity of a mold.
A kind of joint by which an overlap joint is changed to a flush joint by means of a gradually deepening rabbet, as at the ends of clinker-built boats.
To groove; indent.
To place piping or wiring in a groove encased within a wall or floor, or in a hidden space encased by a wall.
definitions.example: chase the pipe

definitions.definition: To cut (the thread of a screw).
To decorate (metal) by engraving or embossing.
